Detailed Description

This class provides methods to access the data of a DataSet.

Definition at line 46 of file DataSet.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DataSet::DataSet ( const std::string &  fileName,
const affymetrix_calvin_io::DataSetHeader &  header,
void *  handle,
bool  loadEntireDataSetHint = false 
)

Constructor. Use this constructor do access the data using memory-mapping. On Windows, memory-mapping will be restricted to 200MB view of the DataSet data.

Parameters:
fileName The name of the generic file to access.
header The DataSetHeader of the DataSet to access.
handle A handle to the file mapping object
loadEntireDataSetHint Indicate if DataSet will attempt to read the entire DataSet data into a memory buffer.

Definition at line 55 of file DataSet.cpp.

References data, fileName, fileStream, header, isOpen, loadEntireDataSetHint, mapLen, mappedData, mapStart, and useMemoryMapping.

DataSet::DataSet ( const std::string &  fileName,
const affymetrix_calvin_io::DataSetHeader &  header,
std::ifstream &  ifs,
bool  loadEntireDataSetHint = false 
)

Constructor. Use this constructor do access the data using std::ifstream. With fstream access the entire DataSet data will be read into memory.

Parameters:
fileName The name of the generic file to access.
header The DataSetHeader of the DataSet to access.
ifs A reference to an open ifstream.
loadEntireDataSetHint Indicate if DataSet will attempt to read the entire DataSet data into a memory buffer.

char * DataSet::FilePosition ( int32_t  rowStart,
int32_t  col,
int32_t  rowCount = 1 
) [protected]

Returns the address of a data element given a row and column. Ensures that data from rowStart to rowCount+rowStart are mapped unless that is larger than the mapped window.

Parameters:
rowStart Row index
col Column index
rowCount The number of rows to ensure are mapped starting at rowStart
Returns:

Exceptions:

void DataSet::GetData ( int32_t  col,
int32_t  startRow,
int32_t  count,
Uint8Vector &  values 
)

Provides access to multiple data elements in the same column. If count elements could not be read, it is not considered an error. The vector is filled with only the data that could be read.

Parameters:

startRow Row index of the data to be inserted into the vector at [0].
count Number of elements to retrieve. -1 indicates to read all
values Reference to the data type to fill with the data.

int32_t DataSet::GetDataRaw ( int32_t  col,
int32_t  startRow,
int32_t  count,
u_int8_t *  values 
)

Provides access to multiple data elements in the same column. The caller is responsible for allocating the storage to which count element values can be written. If count elements could not be read, it is not considered an error. The array is filled with only the data that could be read.

Parameters:
col Column index.
startRow Row index of the data to be inserted into the vector at [0].
count Number of elements to retrieve. -1 indicates to read all
values Reference to the data type to fill with the data.
Returns:
Number of elements read.
Exceptions:
affymetrix_calvin_exceptions::DataSetNotOpenException The file is not memory-mapped.

char * DataSet::LoadDataAndReturnFilePosition ( int32_t  rowStart,
int32_t  col,
int32_t  rowCount 
) [protected]

Returns the address of a data element given a row and column. Ensures that data from rowStart to rowCount+rowStart are copied from the file into a memory buffer. The memory buffer will remain intact until the next call to LoadDataAndReturnFilePosition.

Parameters:
rowStart Row index
col Column index
rowCount The number of rows to ensure are mapped starting at rowStart
Returns:
Pointer to the data element at rowStart
Exceptions:
affymetrix_calvin_exceptions::DataSetNotOpenException The file is not open.
